description.en: Drinks and health is a subject which systematically introduces the students with knowledge of the biochemical composition of drinks and their impacts to the consumer`s health. The drinks are often without necessary attention in our everyday nutrition, although they furnish us with nutrients, food energy and bioactive compounds. The advantages and disadvantages of milk and fermented milk beverages, mineral waters, soft drinks, juices, coffee, cacao and tea, bouillon, beer, cider, wine and alcohol are analysed. This course is biochemistry and medicine-based subject. To get closer to this goals the training programme involves: a) interpreting everyday objects/ situations (drinks commertially or otherwise available) from the point of view of biochemical information (e.g. to list the ingredients from a drink´s lable or producers sources and to analyze them biochemically – as a team work); b) reading sample materials about selected drinks; c)performing an individual referative work on a drink; d) commenting/ analyzing fellow-students referative works; e) performing a test. The course corresponds to 40 hours work so it is not a big course and adding the tasks would only lead to stress about shortage of time – so we concentrate mainly on the health issues of phenolic compounds of drinks, artefitial sweeteners in drinks, additives and preservatives in drinks, possible sources of allergy and intolerance in drinks together with the benefitial effects.
description.et: Joogid ja tervis on õppeaine, mille vältel antakse süstemaatiliselt teadmisi erinevate jookide biokeemilise koostise ja nende mõju kohta tervisele. Sageli on joogid jäänud ilma vajaliku tähelepanuta meie igapäevases söömises, kuigi nad varustavad meid toitainete, toiduenergia ja mitmete eriliste bioaktiivsete ühenditega. Kursuse jooksul analüüsitakse piima ja fermenteeritud piimaproduktide, mineraalvee, karastusjookide, mahlade, kohvi, kakao ja tee, puljongi, õlle, siidri, veini ja alkoholi nii häid kui ka võimalikke probleemseid toimeid tervisele. Antud kursus on inimorganismi biokeemia- ja meditsiinipõhine ning kuulub arstiteaduse üliõpilastel meditsiinilise biokeemia aine juurde. Seetõttu on see valikkursus 2. kursuse kevadsemestri õppekavas.

objectives.en: The aim of this course is to provide the students with basic knowledge of chemical composition of the drinks and their impact on the consumer´s health. All the drinks that may be used by the members of family are analysed. It is known that a rational, healthy diet which includes also the drinks, is both an important tool for disease prevention, and one of the components of systemic treatment.
objectives.et: Tulevane arst peab omama inimorganismi jaoks kehtivaid teaduspõhiseid baasteadmisi tarbitavatest jookidest, nende biokeemilisest koostisest ja mõjust tarbija tervisele. Analüüsitakse kõiki neid jooke, mida tarbitakse. Üldtunnustatud normaalne (tervislik) söömine, mis eeldab ka vedelike tarbimist,  on nii haiguste ennetamise oluline vahend kui ka üks süsteemse pikaajalise ravistrateegia üks komponent.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who graduate the course:
- knows more about the biochemical composition of drinks;
- is able to analyse the possible health issues of drinks on the consumer´s health.
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab analüüsida jookide võimalikke toimeid tarbija tervisele.

independent_work.et: Groupwork to analyse a drink. Individual presentation on a drink (list available in Moodle) and analysis/discussion of a colleague's work.

description.et: Individual presentation on a drink has been done.
A student is able to pass the test.

grade_preconditions.et: A student has to pass all components of this course.

grade_evaluation.et: A test gives 20%, groupwork 20 %, individual work 40% and discussion 20%. All components have to be passed with positive results.

debt_elimination.et: A student can pass the test twice (if the first fails). Other tasks have a due date and extended period that gives less points. If not passed the course can be redone next year.

resources.mandatory_materials: Textfiles and links on the Moodle page of the course.
resources.recommended_materials: U. Kokassaar, M. Zilmer. Joogid ja tervis, Tartu, 2012, 87 lk.

audience.et: Veebipõhine õpe eraldi eesti- ja inglisekeelne
